page.content:
BIGGIN HILL AIR FAIR
The Air Fair was started in 1962 and held in each year at a weekend in May. It is an important recreational event and attracts many thousands of visitors to Biggin Hill with special buses running from Bromley South. In Biggin Hill the roads get very crowded and there is a lot of noise from all the jets. Surrey Aviation, the company running the airport for Bromley Council, started the Air Fair to stimulate intererst in aeroplanes. There is lots of flying with both historic aircraft (e.g. Hurricane, Spitfire, Lancaster) and modern aircraft (e.g. the Red Arrows). Also, there are many exhibitions and displays, and a big fun fair with rides like the American Egg.
